etymology.description: 发(issue; send out) + 票(ticket; slip) = invoice/official receipt.
etymology.interpretation: Literally an “issued slip,” referring to the official receipt or invoice given by a seller, especially for taxation or reimbursement.
etymology.simplification: 發 was simplified to 发 to reduce strokes and speed up common writing; it also merged with 髮 in simplified. 票 remained unchanged.

parts.english: to issue; to send out; to emit; to develop

examples.chinese: 请给我发票(請給我發票。)
examples.english: Please give me an invoice (official receipt).

examples.chinese: 如果需要报销(如果需要報銷)，请索要发票(請索要發票。)
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ xūyào bàoxiāo, qǐng suǒyào fāpiào.
examples.english: If you need reimbursement, please ask for an invoice.

examples.chinese: 商家会把电子发票发到你的邮箱(商家會把電子發票發到你的郵箱。)
examples.pinyin: Shāngjiā huì bǎ diànzǐ fāpiào fā dào nǐ de yóuxiāng.
examples.english: The merchant will send the e-invoice to your email.
